"A consumer’s demand curve for Good X is represented by the equation: Qdx = 50 – 0.2Px where Qdx is the quantity of Good X demanded and Px is the price of Good X. A producer’s supply curve for Good X is represented by the equation: Qsx = 10 + 0.6Px where Qsx is the quantity of Good X supplied and Px is the price of Good X.
